item.title: Memphis City Tour with Optional Riverboat Cruise & Sun Studio Add-On Options
item.description: Explore the top attractions in Memphis on this sightseeing tour along the Mississippi River. See landmark locations like the Memphis Pyramid, now a Bass Pro Shops “megastore” with shopping, a hotel, restaurants, a bowling alley, and an archery range; the National Civil Rights Museum at the Lorraine Motel, where Martin Luther King, Jr. was assassinated and much more. A Memphis hotel pickup and drop-off are included on this tour.

image.alt: Memphis City Tour with Optional Riverboat Cruise & Sun Studio Add-On Options

item.title: Memphis Mojo Bus Tour
item.description: Shake, rattle, and roll through Memphis on this guided musical bus tour. Local musicians lead the way on a fun-loving ride through the home of blues, complete with live music and tambourines, shakers, and bongos for all to enjoy. Visit historic Beale Street, one of the most iconic streets in America, plus Stax Studio, the Lorraine Motel, and more. Upgrade to include admission to Sun Studio, the most famous recording studio in the world.

image.alt: Memphis Mojo Bus Tour

item.title: Taste of Downtown Memphis Food Tour
item.description: Chow down like a bonafide Memphian during this history-packed Memphis food crawl. You’ll enjoy seven specially prepared food tastings at six different hotspots, including both family-owned eateries and award-winning restaurants. Classic dishes—from hot tamales to house-made desserts—use only sustainable, locally sourced ingredients, and you’ll discover the culture and history of the dynamic Tennessee city along the way.

image.alt: Taste of Downtown Memphis Food Tour

item.title: Memphis Discovery Tour
item.description: Experience Memphis on this all-inclusive tour! Visit Beale Street, the Lorraine Motel, and the Mississippi River. Enjoy a BBQ tasting and explore iconic sites like the Rock 'n' Soul Museum or Edge Motor Museum. Discover the history behind the city’s landmarks and immerse yourself in Memphis’ unique culture.

image.alt: Memphis Discovery Tour

item.title: Memphis City Tour with Sun Studio Admission
item.description: Drive past the Mississippi River, grand Victorian homes, and cultural landmarks on this narrated tour of Memphis, which takes you beyond the city’s obvious sights. A tour of the legendary Sun Studios, where artists such as Johnnie Cash and Elvis Presley recorded their music is also included as is round-trip transportation from your downtown Memphis hotel.

image.alt: Memphis City Tour with Sun Studio Admission

item.title: Historic Memphis Guided Walking Tour
item.description: Trace Memphis' history, from the Civil War to modern-day, on this guided walking tour. Learn about the history of this rowdy blues, soul, and rock ‘n’ roll river town, and visit many of the city’s top attractions—Beale Street and sections of the Mississippi River among them. Experience, too, a time-honored Memphis tradition: Peabody Hotel's March of the Ducks.

image.alt: Historic Memphis Guided Walking Tour

item.title: Elvis Presley's Childhood Home Sightseeing Daytrip from Memphis
item.description: When in Memphis, taking this tour to Elvis’ childhood home is a must for fans of the King. Enjoy a comfortable, narrated coach ride to the town of Tupelo, Mississippi, and then tour the Elvis Presley Birthplace childhood home, plus the Elvis Presley Museum, and Tupelo Hardware Company—all important sites in his childhood and musical career.

image.alt: Elvis Presley's Childhood Home Sightseeing Daytrip from Memphis

item.title: Memphis Horseback Trail Ride Tour
item.description: You don’t have to retreat to the country to live your cowboy or cowgirl adventure: this 4,500-acre urban oasis is right in the middle of Memphis. Saddle up and explore the trails inside this sprawling city park, which is home to a variety of wildlife including deer, ducks, cranes, and more. Horses are well-trained and accustomed to riders of all experience levels.

image.alt: Memphis Horseback Trail Ride Tour

item.title: Memphis Discovery Tour with Riverboat Cruise on Mississippi River
item.description: Discover Memphis’ rich history, musical heritage, and Southern cuisine on this comprehensive “best of Memphis” tour. Take in all the highlights of downtown Memphis, from the Blues bars of Beale Street and historic Victorian mansions, to the site where Martin Luther King Jr. was assassinated and one of Elvis’ early apartments. Get insight into the city's amazing musical heritage at the Smithsonian's Rock 'n' Soul Museum, then finish the tour with a delicious BBQ tasting, a photo op of the city skyline at Mud Island Park's iconic "Memphis" sign, and a scenic cruise on the Mississippi River.

image.alt: Memphis Discovery Tour with Riverboat Cruise on Mississippi River

item.title: Memphis Rock 'n' Soul Museum Admission
item.description: The Memphis Rock ‘n’ Soul Museum will have you tapping your toes. Book this admission ticket and discover Memphis' history of blues, rock and soul music. An included audio guide adds depth to the extensive exhibits, with more than 100 songs to bring liveliness to the displays. Delve into Memphis' musical legacy and learn all about the pioneers like BB King and Muddy Waters who put Memphis on the map.

image.alt: Memphis Rock 'n' Soul Museum Admission

item.title: 2.5 Hours Essence of Memphis African American History Tour
item.description: Explore the city of Memphis through the lens of the Civil Rights Movement during this driving sightseeing tour. See key landmarks and monuments that are important to African-American history such as Slave Haven, the National Civil Rights Museum, and Beale Street. Listen to engaging commentary about the history of the area from periods of slavery to the civil rights movement to present-day.

image.alt: 2.5 Hours Essence of Memphis African American History Tour

item.title: Beale Street Guided Walking Tour
item.description: Follow in the footsteps of musical legends, such as Louis Armstrong, Muddy Waters, and B.B. King, on this walking tour of Beale Street in downtown Memphis. Your guide knows the ins and outs of the street—said to be where blues began—ensuring you won't miss a beat of its storied past. Pass by highlights including Lansky Brothers, where Elvis Presley was known to shop, as well as the more-than-100-year-old A. Schwab General Store.

image.alt: Beale Street Guided Walking Tour

item.title: Memphis Haunted History Bus Tour
item.description: Memphis has a unique dark history filled with stories of ghosts, murders, legends, and lore. Explore the city’s spooky areas during this haunted Memphis bus tour, and cover more ground than you would on just a walking tour. Drive through the city as your guide tells you tales about Memphis that are sure to give you goosebumps. During your tour, you'll make a stop at the city’s Victorian Village, as well as downtown.

image.alt: Memphis Haunted History Bus Tour

item.title: Memphis Signature Guided Brewery Tour
item.description: Dive into the vibrant craft beer scene in Memphis with this insider’s tour that includes VIP access to three local breweries for tastings of up to a dozen unique artisan beers. Learn about the history of each brewery and its brewing process from your beer expert guide as you sample a wide variety of microbrews. Enjoy comfortable bus transportation so you can imbibe worry-free.

image.alt: Memphis Signature Guided Brewery Tour

item.title: Elvis Presley Birthplace Park in Tupelo with Transport from Memphis
item.description: Visit the birthplace of Elvis from Memphis, on this guided tour with hassle-free transportation. After being picked up at your hotel, travel to Tupelo, Mississippi, the home where Elvis lived for 13 years. With a guide, tour the 2-room house built by Elvis’ father. Then, visit his elementary school, church, and soda fountain he often frequented.

image.alt: Elvis Presley Birthplace Park in Tupelo with Transport from Memphis

item.title: 1 Hour Axe Throwing in Memphis
item.description: Take aim at an exciting active experience while enjoying local brews at Craft Axe Throwing in Memphis. You’ll receive help from Axe Masters and Axe Coaches who will teach you the technique needed to make the axe stick in the target in three throws or fewer. Hone your technique and keep score with your friends then celebrate with craft beer available for purchase on-site.

image.alt: 1 Hour Axe Throwing in Memphis

item.title: Haunted Memphis Walking Ghost Tour
item.description: Take a spooky stroll through Memphis during this guided ghost walking tour. Experience the darker side of downtown, and hear tales of the city's haunted heritage as told by a local storyteller. Explore Earnestine and Hazel's, a former brothel that is well known as one of the most haunted buildings in Memphis, as well as the Orpheum Theatre and the John Alexander Austin House.

image.alt: Haunted Memphis Walking Ghost Tour

item.title: Guided Memphis City Tour with Riverboat Cruise along Mississippi River
item.description: While visiting Memphis, take a guided sightseeing tour of downtown then board a paddlewheel boat for a cruise on the Mississippi River. See all that Memphis has to offer, including Beale Street and the former mansions of the Victorian Village neighborhood. This combo tour includes hotel pickup and drop-off.

image.alt: Guided Memphis City Tour with Riverboat Cruise along Mississippi River

item.title: Memphis Ghosts: Haunts, Spirits, and Poltergeists Walking Tour
item.description:
Join us on a thrilling walking ghost tour through the eerie streets of Memphis, guided by a local expert who brings haunted history to life with captivating stories. As you walk through the historic district, you'll hear chilling tales of ghostly encounters and the spirits that still linger in some of the city's most iconic buildings.
As you stroll by the Mississippi River, you'll be taken back to a time of sinister saloons, haunted theaters, and ghostly hotels. Beneath the lively vibe of Memphis, known for its delicious barbecue and soulful blues, lies a darker history of hauntings and tragedies.
This mile-long tour covers some of Memphis's most haunted spots. While we can't enter privately owned buildings, you'll stand on haunted ground at every turn, visiting places like the ghostly Arcade Restaurant and the mysterious John Alexander Austin House. Keep your senses sharp—who knows what spirits may be watching!

image.alt: Memphis Ghosts: Haunts, Spirits, and Poltergeists Walking Tour

item.title: Beale Street & Sun Studio: Private Half-Day Walking Tour
item.description: Whether you’re walking in Memphis to your own tune or to the eponymous song, music and history lovers won’t want to miss this private tour. Join a guide for a walking tour of Beale Street and Sun Studios. You’ll learn about Memphis’ diverse musical history and hear stories about everyone from Johnny Cash and Elvis Presley to W.C. Handy and Sam Phillips.

image.alt: Beale Street & Sun Studio: Private Half-Day Walking Tour

item.title: Woodruff-Fontaine House Museum Admission Ticket in Memphis
item.description: Tour the historic Memphis home of the Woodruff and Fontaine families. The Victorian era mansion was built in the French style and is furnished in period antiques. This is your chance to visit the past and learn what Memphis was like in the 19th century. Explore at your own pace on a self-guided tour and learn more by scanning QR codes throughout the house.

image.alt: Woodruff-Fontaine House Museum Admission Ticket in Memphis

item.title: Elvis’ Memphis Journey: Downtown Sites & Graceland Admission
item.description:
Brace yourself for a tour filled with surprises, legends, and rock 'n' roll lore. Here's just a taste of what you'll experience:
Visit the legendary clothing store where Elvis famously threatened to "buy them out" – an epic moment in rock history!
The locations of some of Elvis's favorite hangouts.
Relive the pivotal role Beale Street played in shaping Elvis's career – the heart and soul of his musical journey.
Explore the mesmerizing venue that ignited the flame of Elvis Presley's unrivaled stardom – where he became the one and only King!
Get a sneak peek into the cinematic world of the icon as you discover exclusive sites featured in the Baz Luhrmann Elvis movie.
See the high school where Elvis earned his diploma – a significant part of his early years.
And guess what? There's "much, much more" waiting to be unveiled on this thrilling adventure. Buckle up, because this tour is an absolute blast from start to finish!
2-Hour downtown tour by car Of Elvis sites.

image.alt: Elvis’ Memphis Journey: Downtown Sites & Graceland Admission

item.title: Memphis True Crime Tour
item.description: Explore the darker side of Memphis history. A twilight exploration of Memphis' murderous, scandalous, fascinating past, complete with serial killers, mobsters, vengeful lovers, and compelling unsolved cases. A knowledgeable local guide will take you to the scene of some of the city's most notorious crimes. Along the way you'll learn about: -A serial killer's summer of terror -Beale Street's deadliest saloon -Georgia Tann, notorious baby thief -Memphis' coldest case -Alma Theede, the "Black Widow" of Vance Avenue -the largest jail break in Shelby County history -and more! We'll even make a special stop for custom, to-die-for cocktails at the stylish Moxy Hotel (mocktails, soda, and water also available).

image.alt: Memphis True Crime Tour

item.title: Memphis Hop On and Hop Off Tour
item.description: Why you should choose us? UNLIMITED RIDES- Hop on and off as many times as you like. You can hop off at any of our 10 different stops and tour at your own pace. You can ride the loop, while you are entertained by our professional tour guides who will have a story to tell you.

image.alt: Memphis Hop On and Hop Off Tour
